h1: BBVA: NFT LOYALTY REWARDS FOR BANKING

client.name: BBVA Mexico
client.description: BBVA (Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria) is one of the largest financial institutions in the world with operations in Spain, Mexico, South America, and the United States. BBVA Mexico is the second-largest bank in Mexico serving millions of customers with retail banking, corporate banking, and investment services.

challenge.title: Outdated Loyalty Program & Low Customer Engagement
challenge.description: BBVA's traditional points-based loyalty program suffered from low engagement and redemption rates. Customers accumulated points but rarely redeemed them, leading to massive liabilities on the balance sheet. The bank needed a modern, digital-first loyalty experience that would excite younger demographics and differentiate BBVA from competitors.
painPoints: Only 12% of loyalty points redeemed annually‚Äî$50M+ in unredeemed point liabilities
Traditional rewards catalog (appliances, flights) didn't resonate with younger customers
No sense of exclusivity or collectibility‚Äîpoints felt like an afterthought
Competitors launching crypto and Web3 initiatives, BBVA at risk of appearing outdated
Loyalty program not driving new account acquisition or increased card spend

solution.title: NFT-Based Loyalty & Digital Collectibles Platform
solution.description: Avocado built a blockchain-powered loyalty platform where BBVA customers earn NFT collectibles instead of traditional points. Customers unlock exclusive digital collectibles by reaching spending milestones, maintaining account balances, or participating in promotions. NFTs are tradeable and unlock real-world rewards: VIP experiences, exclusive merchandise, and premium banking benefits.

technicalApproach.title: NFT Reward Architecture
technicalApproach.description: ERC-721 NFTs deployed on Polygon for low gas fees and fast transactions. Tiered collectibles: Bronze, Silver, Gold, and Platinum tiers based on customer activity. Limited edition drops for special promotions (holiday campaigns, new product launches). Customers claim NFTs through the BBVA app‚Äîno crypto knowledge required.

technicalApproach.title: Seamless Banking Integration
technicalApproach.description: Deep integration with BBVA's core banking APIs. NFT rewards triggered automatically by spending thresholds, account anniversaries, and promotional activities. Customers view their NFT collection within the existing BBVA mobile app. No separate wallet or crypto knowledge needed‚Äîcustodial wallets managed by the platform.

technicalApproach.title: Utility & Redemption
technicalApproach.description: Each NFT tier unlocks specific benefits: VIP airport lounge access, exclusive concert presales, premium customer support lines, and higher cashback rates. Limited edition NFTs grant access to exclusive experiences: private dinners, sports events, and meet-and-greets. Customers can trade NFTs on a secondary marketplace, creating a collecting dynamic.

solution.timeline: 8 weeks: 2 weeks architecture and smart contract development, 4 weeks platform build and banking integration, 2 weeks security audit and phased rollout

metrics.description: Customer interaction with loyalty program increased 45% after NFT launch

metrics.label: NFTs claimed in first month
metrics.description: Over 10,000 customers claimed NFT rewards within 30 days of launch

metrics.label: Increase in card spend
metrics.description: Customers actively pursuing NFT milestones increased card spending by 28%

metrics.label: Press coverage
metrics.description: Featured in Forbes, Bloomberg L√≠nea, and banking industry publications as innovation leader

results.businessImpact: BBVA transformed its loyalty program from a liability to a customer engagement driver. NFT collectibility created emotional attachment that traditional points never achieved. Younger demographics (25-40) showed 3x higher engagement than the previous program. The initiative generated significant press coverage positioning BBVA as an innovation leader in Latin American banking. Card spending increased 28% among active participants, directly impacting revenue.

client.name: Club Deportivo Guadalajara (Chivas)
client.description: Chivas is one of Mexico's most valuable and popular soccer teams, competing in Liga MX. Founded in 1906, Chivas has won 12 Liga MX championships and is known for its unique policy of fielding only Mexican players. The club has millions of fans across Mexico and the United States.

challenge.title: Limited Digital Revenue & Fan Engagement
challenge.description: Chivas' revenue came primarily from traditional sources: ticket sales, merchandise, and sponsorships. Younger fans (ages 18-34) were increasingly engaging with the brand through social media rather than stadium attendance or merchandise purchases. The team needed new digital revenue streams and deeper fan relationships beyond game days.
painPoints: Declining stadium attendance among younger demographics (18-34 age group)
Social media engagement not translating to revenue‚Äîmillions of followers but limited monetization
No direct relationship with fans‚Äîmerchandise sold through third-party retailers
Traditional sponsorships plateauing‚Äîsponsors wanted digital engagement metrics
Missing the Web3 / NFT trend being adopted by NBA, NFL, and European soccer teams

solution.title: NFT Platform with Digital Collectibles
solution.description: Avocado built a custom NFT platform for Chivas featuring digital collectibles tied to match highlights, player milestones, and exclusive fan experiences. Fans purchase NFTs using credit cards (no crypto knowledge required) and collect/trade digital memorabilia. NFT holders unlock exclusive benefits: VIP experiences, meet-and-greets with players, signed merchandise, and token-gated content.

technicalApproach.title: Smart Contract Architecture
technicalApproach.description: ERC-721 NFT contracts deployed on Polygon for low transaction fees (under $0.05 per mint vs $20-50 on Ethereum mainnet). Lazy minting allows cost-efficient drops without pre-minting gas fees. Royalty enforcement: Chivas earns 7.5% on every secondary market trade. Allowlist mechanics for presales to fan club members.

technicalApproach.title: Fiat Payment Integration
technicalApproach.description: Credit card checkout via Crossmint‚Äîfans purchase NFTs with USD/MXN without owning cryptocurrency. We handle wallet creation and crypto conversion behind the scenes. Advanced users can connect MetaMask or WalletConnect for Web3 wallet support.

technicalApproach.title: NFT Utility & Experiences
technicalApproach.description: Each NFT collection unlocks specific benefits: Golden Ball NFTs grant access to exclusive meet-and-greets with players. Legendary Match NFTs include signed jerseys and VIP stadium tours. All NFT holders get access to token-gated Discord channels and exclusive video content.

solution.timeline: 4 weeks: 1 week smart contract development, 2 weeks frontend and payment integration, 1 week security audit and launch

metrics.description: Sold out in 48 hours with 5,000+ unique collectors

metrics.label: Primary sales revenue
metrics.description: Generated $250,000+ in initial NFT sales, plus ongoing 7.5% royalties on secondary trades

metrics.label: International collectors
metrics.description: 60% of NFT buyers located in United States, expanding Chivas' international fanbase

metrics.label: Media coverage

results.businessImpact: Chivas created a new revenue stream generating $250K+ in primary NFT sales plus ongoing royalty income from secondary market trades. Chivas positioned itself as the Liga MX technology leader, ahead of rivals Club Am√©rica and Cruz Azul.

technicalApproach.description: ERC-721 NFTs deployed on Ethereum mainnet for maximum credibility and permanence. Each physical jersey paired with a unique NFT featuring the same design rendered in 3D. NFC chips embedded in physical jerseys linked to blockchain records for authenticity verification. name: Banorte
fullName: Banorte & R3 Corda - High-Performance Stablecoin Settlement Network
metaTitle: Banorte Case Study: Blockchain Settlement Network | Avocado Dev Studio
metaDescription: How Avocado built a proof-of-concept stablecoin settlement network for Banorte and major Mexican banks using R3 Corda. Achieved 20,000+ transactions per second for instant interbank settlements.

client.name: Grupo Financiero Banorte
client.description: Banorte is Mexico's third-largest bank and the largest Mexican-owned financial institution with 1,800+ branches serving 20 million customers. The bank provides retail banking, corporate banking, insurance, asset management, and pension fund services. Banorte emphasizes digital transformation and financial inclusion across Mexico.

challenge.title: Slow and Costly Interbank Settlements
challenge.description: Traditional interbank settlement systems in Mexico relied on batch processing with T+1 or T+2 settlement times. Real-time gross settlement (RTGS) systems existed but were expensive and limited in throughput. Mexican banks sought a next-generation settlement infrastructure that could enable instant, low-cost transfers at massive scale using stablecoin technology.
painPoints: Interbank settlements taking 1-2 business days, creating liquidity inefficiencies
High transaction fees for real-time transfers eating into margins
Legacy RTGS systems unable to handle growing transaction volumes
No infrastructure for programmable money or smart contract-based settlements
Need to prepare for central bank digital currency (CBDC) and stablecoin future

solution.title: R3 Corda Stablecoin Settlement Network PoC
solution.description: Avocado partnered with Banorte, other major Mexican banks, and R3 to build a proof-of-concept settlement network running on Corda enterprise blockchain. The network enabled instant settlement of stablecoin-denominated transactions between participating banks. The PoC demonstrated that blockchain could handle enterprise-grade transaction volumes while maintaining regulatory compliance and privacy.

technicalApproach.title: R3 Corda Enterprise Architecture
technicalApproach.description: Deployed R3 Corda Enterprise nodes for each participating bank. Corda's unique architecture ensures transaction privacy‚Äîonly parties involved in a transaction see the details, unlike public blockchains. Notary nodes provide consensus and prevent double-spending. Each bank maintains its own node while participating in the shared network.

technicalApproach.title: Stablecoin Implementation
technicalApproach.description: Custom CorDapp (Corda application) implementing peso-denominated stablecoin issuance, transfer, and redemption. Banks issue stablecoins backed by reserves held at the central bank or in segregated accounts. Atomic settlement ensures transfers complete instantly or not at all. Smart contracts enforce compliance rules and transaction limits.

technicalApproach.title: Performance Optimization
technicalApproach.description: Extensive performance tuning to achieve maximum throughput. Parallel transaction processing across multiple notary nodes. Optimized database configurations and network topology. Load testing infrastructure to validate real-world performance under stress conditions.

solution.timeline: 10 weeks: 3 weeks architecture and node deployment, 4 weeks CorDapp development and integration, 3 weeks performance testing and optimization

metrics.label: Transactions per second
metrics.description: PoC achieved over 20,000 TPS‚Äîfar exceeding requirements for national settlement infrastructure

metrics.label: Settlement finality
metrics.description: Transactions settle in under 1 second with cryptographic finality, vs T+1/T+2 traditional systems

metrics.label: Consortium participation
metrics.description: Successfully demonstrated interoperability between multiple major Mexican financial institutions

metrics.label: Privacy & compliance
metrics.description: Corda's privacy model ensures transaction details visible only to participating parties

results.businessImpact: The PoC proved that blockchain-based settlement infrastructure could handle Mexico's national transaction volumes with room to spare. 20,000+ TPS far exceeded the ~5,000 TPS peak load of existing systems. Instant settlement would unlock billions in trapped liquidity currently tied up in T+1/T+2 delays. The project positioned participating banks as leaders in financial infrastructure innovation and prepared them for future CBDC and stablecoin initiatives from Banco de M√©xico.

quote.text: Avocado's blockchain expertise helped us prove what many thought impossible‚Äîenterprise-grade transaction throughput on distributed ledger technology. 20,000 TPS changes the conversation about what's possible for national payment infrastructure.
quote.author: Director of Innovation, Banorte
